 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;

    background: none;

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>There is a race-condition bug in browser process. Here is the code from |PopulateServiceWorkerBinders| in <span class="line"><!---->There is a race-condition bug in browser process. Here is the code from |PopulateServiceWorkerBinders| in <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/browser_interface_binders.cc;l=1227<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/browser_interface_binders.cc;l=1227"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/browser_interface_binders.cc;l=1227<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>"""<span class="line"><!---->"""<!----></span><br> map->Add<blink::mojom::FileUtilitiesHost>(<span class="line"><!----> map-&gt;Add&lt;blink::mojom::FileUtilitiesHost&gt;(<!----></span><br>      base::BindRepeating(&BindFileUtilitiesHost, host),<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindRepeating(&amp;BindFileUtilitiesHost, host),<!----></span><br>      base::ThreadPool::CreateSequencedTaskRunner(<span class="line"><!---->      base::ThreadPool::CreateSequencedTaskRunner(<!----></span><br>          {base::MayBlock(), base::TaskPriority::USER_VISIBLE}));<span class="line"><!---->          {base::MayBlock(), base::TaskPriority::USER_VISIBLE}));<!----></span><br>"""<span class="line"><!---->"""<!----></span><br><br>It transfer the |host| raw pointer to function |BindFileUtilitiesHost|, but the callback will runs on a separate task runner. On the other hand, we can free the |ServiceWorkerHost::host| object on the browser main thread.<span class="line"><!---->It transfer the |host| raw pointer to function |BindFileUtilitiesHost|, but the callback will runs on a separate task runner. On the other hand, we can free the |ServiceWorkerHost::host| object on the browser main thread.<!----></span><br><br>So in the function |BindFileUtilitiesHost| it uses the dangling pointer |host| to call |host->worker_process_id()| to create a |FileUtilitiesHostImpl| object. In the futher exploit, we can fake the process_id to create a more power |FileUtilitiesHostImpl| object, and use this interface to read files out of sandbox.<span class="line"><!---->So in the function |BindFileUtilitiesHost| it uses the dangling pointer |host| to call |host-&gt;worker_process_id()| to create a |FileUtilitiesHostImpl| object. In the futher exploit, we can fake the process_id to create a more power |FileUtilitiesHostImpl| object, and use this interface to read files out of sandbox.<!----></span><br><br>how to reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->how to reproduce:<!----></span><br>$python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/Asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->$python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/Asan/gen<!----></span><br>$out/Asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS  '<span class="line"><!---->$out/Asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS  '<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/1.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/1.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/1.html<!----></a>'<span class="line"><!---->'<!----></span><br><br>Note that this is *not* a renderer bug; it's a browser process bug that's reachable from the renderer.<span class="line"><!---->Note that this is *not* a renderer bug; it's a browser process bug that's reachable from the renderer.<!----></span><br><br>*Please note that this bug may be can trigger with normal render process(not compromised) if we can find some web API to create many FileUtilitiesHost mojo interface. In theory, create ONLY ONE FileUtilitiesHost can trigger the bug too, but it is hard to win the race.*<span class="line"><!---->*Please note that this bug may be can trigger with normal render process(not compromised) if we can find some web API to create many FileUtilitiesHost mojo interface. In theory, create ONLY ONE FileUtilitiesHost can trigger the bug too, but it is hard to win the race.*<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: compile the ASAN version chromium with latest code<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: compile the ASAN version chromium with latest code<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: <span class="line"><!---->Crash State: <!----></span><br>==196032==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x12046446efc0 at pc 0x7ffed2cbea0b bp 0x00d9047fee20 sp 0x00d9047fee68<span class="line"><!---->==196032==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x12046446efc0 at pc 0x7ffed2cbea0b bp 0x00d9047fee20 sp 0x00d9047fee68<!----></span><br>READ of size 4 at 0x12046446efc0 thread T32<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 4 at 0x12046446efc0 thread T32<!----></span><br>    #0 0x7ffed2cbea0a in content::ServiceWorkerHost::worker_process_id content\browser\service_worker\service_worker_host.h:59<span class="line"><!---->    #0 0x7ffed2cbea0a in content::ServiceWorkerHost::worker_process_id content\browser\service_worker\service_worker_host.h:59<!----></span><br>    #1 0x7ffed2cbea0a in content::internal::`anonymous namespace'::BindFileUtilitiesHost content\browser\browser_interface_binders.cc:370:1<span class="line"><!---->    #1 0x7ffed2cbea0a in content::internal::`anonymous namespace'::BindFileUtilitiesHost content\browser\browser_interface_binders.cc:370:1<!----></span><br>    #2 0x7ffed2cc682d in base::internal::FunctorTraits<void (*)(const content::ServiceWorkerHost *, mojo::PendingReceiver<blink::mojom::FileUtilitiesHost>),void>::Invoke base\bind_internal.h:404<span class="line"><!---->    #2 0x7ffed2cc682d in base::internal::FunctorTraits&lt;void (*)(const base\bind_internal.h:721<!----></span><br>    #5 0x7ffed2cc682d in base::internal::Invoker<struct base::internal::BindState<void (__cdecl *)(class content::ServiceWorkerHost const *, class         Ah, now I remember why I didn't pass the process ID instead of binding the host in the first place - the process may not exist at the time the binder map is populated. See PS1 here[1] for sample failures.<span class="line"><!---->Ah, now I remember why I didn't pass the process ID instead of binding the host in the first place - the process may not exist at the time the binder map is populated. See PS1 here[1] for sample failures.<!----></span><br><br>So I'm going to use a WeakPtr instead, hopefully that won't cause any test failures.<span class="line"><!---->So I'm going to use a WeakPtr instead, hopefully that won't cause any test failures.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/e2123a8e0943b4399814bd530df401ed071b6d0f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/e2123a8e0943b4399814bd530df401ed071b6d0f"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/e2123a8e0943b4399814bd530df401ed071b6d0f<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>e2123a8e0943b4399814bd530df401ed071b6d0f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/e2123a8e0943b4399814bd530df401ed071b6d0f"><!---->e2123a8e0943b4399814bd530df401ed071b6d0f<!----></a><br>Author: Tal Pressman <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Tal Pressman &lt;<!----></span>talp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/talp@chromium.org"><!---->talp@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Jul 21 09:11:13 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Jul 21 09:11:13 2021<!----></span><br><br>Manually post task to bind FileUtilitiesHost.<span class="line"><!---->Manually post task to bind FileUtilitiesHost.<!----></span><br><br>The FileUtilitiesHost binder is posted to a separate sequence, and the<span class="line"><!---->The FileUtilitiesHost binder is posted to a separate sequence, and the<!----></span><br>ServiceWorkerHost may be destroyed by the time the it runs, causing a<span class="line"><!---->ServiceWorkerHost may be destroyed by the time the it runs, causing a<!----></span><br>UAF.<span class="line"><!---->UAF.<!----></span><br>This CL changes it so that, when we try to bind a new receiver, the<span class="line"><!---->This CL changes it so that, when we try to bind a new receiver, the<!----></span><br>host's worker_process_id() is obtained first (on the service worker's<span class="line"><!---->host's worker_process_id() is obtained first (on the service worker's<!----></span><br>core thread) and then a task is posted to do the actual binding on a<span class="line"><!---->core thread) and then a task is posted to do the actual binding on a<!----></span><br>USER_VISIBLE task runner.<span class="line"><!---->USER_VISIBLE task runner.<!----></span><br><br>Credit: This issue was first reported (with analysis) by<span class="line"><!---->Credit: This issue was first reported (with analysis) by<!----></span><br>soulchen8650@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/soulchen8650@gmail.com"><!---->soulchen8650@gmail.com<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1229298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a498cfe6a2294c5e8023a31000605d62538b5c29<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a498cfe6a2294c5e8023a31000605d62538b5c29"><!---->a498cfe6a2294c5e8023a31000605d62538b5c29<!----></a><br>Author: Tal Pressman <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Tal Pressman &lt;<!----></span>talp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/talp@chromium.org"><!---->talp@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jul 27 03:05:48 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jul 27 03:05:48 2021<!----></span><br><br>Manually post task to bind FileUtilitiesHost.<span class="line"><!---->Manually post task to bind FileUtilitiesHost.<!----></span><br><br>This is a merge of<span class="line"><!---->This is a merge of<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/3041006<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3041006"><!---->crrev.com/c/3041006<!----></a> to the M93 branch.<span class="line"><!----> to the M93 branch.<!----></span><br><br>The FileUtilitiesHost binder is posted to a separate sequence, and the<span class="line"><!---->The FileUtilitiesHost binder is posted to a separate sequence, and the<!----></span><br>ServiceWorkerHost may be destroyed by the time the it runs, causing a<span class="line"><!---->ServiceWorkerHost may be destroyed by the time the it runs, causing a<!----></span><br>UAF.<span class="line"><!---->UAF.<!----></span><br>This CL changes it so that, when we try to bind a new receiver, the<span class="line"><!---->This CL changes it so that, when we try to bind a new receiver, the<!----></span><br>host's worker_process_id() is obtained first (on the service worker's<span class="line"><!---->host's worker_process_id() is obtained first (on the service worker's<!----></span><br>core thread) and then a task is posted to do the actual binding on a<span class="line"><!---->core thread) and then a task is posted to do the actual binding on a<!----></span><br>USER_VISIBLE task runner.<span class="line"><!---->USER_VISIBLE task runner.<!----></span><br><br>Credit: This issue was first reported (with analysis) by<span class="line"><!---->Credit: This issue was first reported (with analysis) by<!----></span><br>soulchen8650@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/soulchen8650@gmail.com"><!---->soulchen8650@gmail.com<!----></a>.<span         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f024e59f574ee3ca4297d35810e4c96ebd223173<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f024e59f574ee3ca4297d35810e4c96ebd223173"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f024e59f574ee3ca4297d35810e4c96ebd223173<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f024e59f574ee3ca4297d35810e4c96ebd223173<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f024e59f574ee3ca4297d35810e4c96ebd223173"><!---->f024e59f574ee3ca4297d35810e4c96ebd223173<!----></a><br>Author: Tal Pressman <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Tal Pressman &lt;<!----></span>talp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/talp@chromium.org"><!---->talp@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Jul 28 03:01:32 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Jul 28 03:01:32 2021<!----></span><br><br>Manually post task to bind FileUtilitiesHost.<span class="line"><!---->Manually post task to bind FileUtilitiesHost.<!----></span><br><br>This is a merge of<span class="line"><!---->This is a merge of<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/3041006<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3041006"><!---->crrev.com/c/3041006<!----></a> to the M91 branch.<span class="line"><!----> to the M91 branch.<!----></span><br><br>The FileUtilitiesHost binder is posted to a separate sequence, and the<span class="line"><!---->The FileUtilitiesHost binder is posted to a separate sequence, and the<!----></span><br>ServiceWorkerHost may be destroyed by the time the it runs, causing a<span class="line"><!---->ServiceWorkerHost may be destroyed by the time the it runs, causing a<!----></span><br>UAF.<span class="line"><!---->UAF.<!----></span><br>This CL changes it so that, when we try to bind a new receiver, the<span class="line"><!---->This CL changes it so that, when we try to bind a new receiver, the<!----></span><br>host's worker_process_id() is obtained first (on the service worker's<span class="line"><!---->host's worker_process_id() is obtained first (on the service worker's<!----></span><br>core thread) and then a task is posted to do the actual binding on a<span class="line"><!---->core thread) and then a task is posted to do the actual binding on a<!----></span><br>USER_VISIBLE task runner.<span class="line"><!---->USER_VISIBLE task runner.<!----></span><br><br>Credit: This issue was first reported (with analysis) by<span class="line"><!---->Credit: This issue was first reported (with analysis) by<!----></span><br>soulchen8650@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/soulchen8650@gmail.com"><!---->soulchen8650@gmail.com<!----></a>.<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/995064c730323afab2ab92fd1fef50f7d41b19f4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/995064c730323afab2ab92fd1fef50f7d41b19f4"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/995064c730323afab2ab92fd1fef50f7d41b19f4<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>995064c730323afab2ab92fd1fef50f7d41b19f4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/995064c730323afab2ab92fd1fef50f7d41b19f4"><!---->995064c730323afab2ab92fd1fef50f7d41b19f4<!----></a><br>Author: Tal Pressman <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Tal Pressman &lt;<!----></span>talp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/talp@chromium.org"><!---->talp@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Aug 10 06:36:26 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Aug 10 06:36:26 2021<!----></span><br><br>[M90-LTS] Manually post task to bind FileUtilitiesHost.<span class="line"><!---->[M90-LTS] Manually post task to bind FileUtilitiesHost.<!----></span><br><br>The FileUtilitiesHost binder is posted to a separate sequence, and the<span class="line"><!---->The FileUtilitiesHost binder is posted to a separate sequence, and the<!----></span><br>ServiceWorkerHost may be destroyed by the time the it runs, causing a<span class="line"><!---->ServiceWorkerHost may be destroyed by the time the it runs, causing a<!----></span><br>UAF.<span class="line"><!---->UAF.<!----></span><br>This CL changes it so that, when we try to bind a new receiver, the<span class="line"><!---->This CL changes it so that, when we try to bind a new receiver, the<!----></span><br>host's worker_process_id() is obtained first (on the service worker's<span class="line"><!---->host's worker_process_id() is obtained first (on the service worker's<!----></span><br>core thread) and then a task is posted to do the actual binding on a<span class="line"><!---->core thread) and then a task is posted to do the actual binding on a<!----></span><br>USER_VISIBLE task runner.<span class="line"><!---->USER_VISIBLE task runner.<!----></span><br><br>Credit: This issue was first reported (with analysis) by<span class="line"><!---->Credit: This issue was first reported (with analysis) by<!----></span><br>soulchen8650@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank"       <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */

          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

          z-index: 999;

           * there's spacing. */

          display: block;

        mr-issue-page {

          max-width: 1000px;

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;

  }

    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;

  }

    font-weight: bold;

    }

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);

          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }

          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>There is a race-condition bug in browser process. Here is the code from |PopulateServiceWorkerBinders| in <span class="line"><!---->There is a race-condition bug in browser process. Here is the code from |PopulateServiceWorkerBinders| in <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/browser_interface_binders.cc;l=1227<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/browser_interface_binders.cc;l=1227"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/browser_interface_binders.cc;l=1227<!----></a>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br>"""<span class="line"><!---->"""<!----></span><br> map->Add<blink::mojom::FileUtilitiesHost>(<span class="line"><!----> map-&gt;Add&lt;blink::mojom::FileUtilitiesHost&gt;(<!----></span><br>      base::BindRepeating(&BindFileUtilitiesHost, host),<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindRepeating(&amp;BindFileUtilitiesHost, host),<!----></span><br>      base::ThreadPool::CreateSequencedTaskRunner(<span class="line"><!---->      base::ThreadPool::CreateSequencedTaskRunner(<!----></span><br>          {base::MayBlock(), base::TaskPriority::USER_VISIBLE}));<span class="line"><!---->          {base::MayBlock(), base::TaskPriority::USER_VISIBLE}));<!----></span><br>"""<span class="line"><!---->"""<!----></span><br><br>It transfer the |host| raw pointer to function |BindFileUtilitiesHost|, but the callback will runs on a separate task runner. On the other hand, we can free the |ServiceWorkerHost::host| object on the browser main thread.<span class="line"><!---->It transfer the |host| raw pointer to function |BindFileUtilitiesHost|, but the callback will runs on a separate task runner. On the other hand, we can free the |ServiceWorkerHost::host| object on the browser main thread.<!----></span><br><br>So in the function |BindFileUtilitiesHost| it uses the dangling pointer |host| to call |host->worker_process_id()| to create a |FileUtilitiesHostImpl| object. In the futher exploit, we can fake the process_id to create a more power |FileUtilitiesHostImpl| object, and use this interface to read files out of sandbox.<span class="line"><!---->So in the function |BindFileUtilitiesHost| it uses the dangling pointer |host| to call |host-&gt;worker_process_id()| to create a |FileUtilitiesHostImpl| object. In the futher exploit, we can fake the process_id to create a more power |FileUtilitiesHostImpl| object, and use this interface to read files out of sandbox.<!----></span><br><br>how to reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->how to reproduce:<!----></span><br>$python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/Asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->$python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/Asan/gen<!----></span><br>$out/Asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS  '<span class="line"><!---->$out/Asan/chrome --enable-blink-features=MojoJS  '<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/1.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/1.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/1.html<!----></a>'<span class="line"><!---->'<!----></span><br><br>Note that this is *not* a renderer bug; it's a browser process bug that's reachable from the renderer.<span class="line"><!---->Note that this is *not* a renderer bug; it's a browser process bug that's reachable from the renderer.<!----></span><br><br>*Please note that this bug may be can trigger with normal render process(not compromised) if we can find some web API to create many FileUtilitiesHost mojo interface. In theory, create ONLY ONE FileUtilitiesHost can trigger the bug too, but it is hard to win the race.*<span class="line"><!---->*Please note that this bug may be can trigger with normal render process(not compromised) if we can find some web API to create many FileUtilitiesHost mojo interface. In theory, create ONLY ONE FileUtilitiesHost can trigger the bug too, but it is hard to win the race.*<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: compile the ASAN version chromium with latest code<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: compile the ASAN version chromium with latest code<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: <span class="line"><!---->Crash State: <!----></span><br>==196032==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x12046446efc0 at pc 0x7ffed2cbea0b bp 0x00d9047fee20 sp 0x00d9047fee68<span class="line"><!---->==196032==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x12046446efc0 at pc 0x7ffed2cbea0b bp 0x00d9047fee20 sp 0x00d9047fee68<!----></span><br>READ of size 4 at 0x12046446efc0 thread T32<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 4 at 0x12046446efc0 thread T32<!----></span><br>    #0 0x7ffed2cbea0a in content::ServiceWorkerHost::worker_process_id content\browser\service_worker\service_worker_host.h:59<span class="line"><!---->    #0 0x7ffed2cbea0a in content::ServiceWorkerHost::worker_process_id content\browser\service_worker\service_worker_host.h:59<!----></span><br>    #1 0x7ffed2cbea0a in content::internal::`anonymous namespace'::BindFileUtilitiesHost content\browser\browser_interface_binders.cc:370:1<span class="line"><!---->    #1 0x7ffed2cbea0a in content::internal::`anonymous namespace'::BindFileUtilitiesHost content\browser\browser_interface_binders.cc:370:1<!----></span><br>    #2 0x7ffed2cc682d in base::internal::FunctorTraits<void (*)(const content::ServiceWorkerHost *, mojo::PendingReceiver<blink::mojom::FileUtilitiesHost>),void>::Invoke base\bind_internal.h:404<span class="line"><!---->    #2 0x7ffed2cc682d in base::internal::FunctorTraits&lt;void (*)(const base\bind_internal.h:721<!----></span><br>    #5 0x7ffed2cc682d in base::internal::Invoker<struct base::internal::BindState<void (__cdecl *)(class content::ServiceWorkerHost const *, class         Ah, now I remember why I didn't pass the process ID instead of binding the host in the first place - the process may not exist at the time the binder map is populated. See PS1 here[1] for sample failures.<span class="line"><!---->Ah, now I remember why I didn't pass the process ID instead of binding the host in the first place - the process may not exist at the time the binder map is populated. See PS1 here[1] for sample failures.<!----></span><br><br>So I'm going to use a WeakPtr instead, hopefully that won't cause any test failures.<span class="line"><!---->So I'm going to use a WeakPtr instead, hopefully that won't cause any test failures.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/e2123a8e0943b4399814bd530df401ed071b6d0f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/e2123a8e0943b4399814bd530df401ed071b6d0f"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/e2123a8e0943b4399814bd530df401ed071b6d0f<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>e2123a8e0943b4399814bd530df401ed071b6d0f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/e2123a8e0943b4399814bd530df401ed071b6d0f"><!---->e2123a8e0943b4399814bd530df401ed071b6d0f<!----></a><br>Author: Tal Pressman <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Tal Pressman &lt;<!----></span>talp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/talp@chromium.org"><!---->talp@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Jul 21 09:11:13 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Jul 21 09:11:13 2021<!----></span><br><br>Manually post task to bind FileUtilitiesHost.<span class="line"><!---->Manually post task to bind FileUtilitiesHost.<!----></span><br><br>The FileUtilitiesHost binder is posted to a separate sequence, and the<span class="line"><!---->The FileUtilitiesHost binder is posted to a separate sequence, and the<!----></span><br>ServiceWorkerHost may be destroyed by the time the it runs, causing a<span class="line"><!---->ServiceWorkerHost may be destroyed by the time the it runs, causing a<!----></span><br>UAF.<span class="line"><!---->UAF.<!----></span><br>This CL changes it so that, when we try to bind a new receiver, the<span class="line"><!---->This CL changes it so that, when we try to bind a new receiver, the<!----></span><br>host's worker_process_id() is obtained first (on the service worker's<span class="line"><!---->host's worker_process_id() is obtained first (on the service worker's<!----></span><br>core thread) and then a task is posted to do the actual binding on a<span class="line"><!---->core thread) and then a task is posted to do the actual binding on a<!----></span><br>USER_VISIBLE task runner.<span class="line"><!---->USER_VISIBLE task runner.<!----></span><br><br>Credit: This issue was first reported (with analysis) by<span class="line"><!---->Credit: This issue was first reported (with analysis) by<!----></span><br>soulchen8650@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/soulchen8650@gmail.com"><!---->soulchen8650@gmail.com<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1229298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a498cfe6a2294c5e8023a31000605d62538b5c29<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a498cfe6a2294c5e8023a31000605d62538b5c29"><!---->a498cfe6a2294c5e8023a31000605d62538b5c29<!----></a><br>Author: Tal Pressman <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Tal Pressman &lt;<!----></span>talp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/talp@chromium.org"><!---->talp@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jul 27 03:05:48 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jul 27 03:05:48 2021<!----></span><br><br>Manually post task to bind FileUtilitiesHost.<span class="line"><!---->Manually post task to bind FileUtilitiesHost.<!----></span><br><br>This is a merge of<span class="line"><!---->This is a merge of<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/3041006<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3041006"><!---->crrev.com/c/3041006<!----></a> to the M93 branch.<span class="line"><!----> to the M93 branch.<!----></span><br><br>The FileUtilitiesHost binder is posted to a separate sequence, and the<span class="line"><!---->The FileUtilitiesHost binder is posted to a separate sequence, and the<!----></span><br>ServiceWorkerHost may be destroyed by the time the it runs, causing a<span class="line"><!---->ServiceWorkerHost may be destroyed by the time the it runs, causing a<!----></span><br>UAF.<span class="line"><!---->UAF.<!----></span><br>This CL changes it so that, when we try to bind a new receiver, the<span class="line"><!---->This CL changes it so that, when we try to bind a new receiver, the<!----></span><br>host's worker_process_id() is obtained first (on the service worker's<span class="line"><!---->host's worker_process_id() is obtained first (on the service worker's<!----></span><br>core thread) and then a task is posted to do the actual binding on a<span class="line"><!---->core thread) and then a task is posted to do the actual binding on a<!----></span><br>USER_VISIBLE task runner.<span class="line"><!---->USER_VISIBLE task runner.<!----></span><br><br>Credit: This issue was first reported (with analysis) by<span class="line"><!---->Credit: This issue was first reported (with analysis) by<!----></span><br>soulchen8650@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/soulchen8650@gmail.com"><!---->soulchen8650@gmail.com<!----></a>.<span
